perfcenter.analytical

Class SolverSingleClosedMVA

  • java.lang.Object
    • perfcenter.analytical.Solver
      • perfcenter.analytical.SolverSingleClosedMVA

  • public class SolverSingleClosedMVA
extends Solver
    Solves a single class closed model, using Aggregated Mean Value Analysis algorithm.
    Author:
    Federico Granata, Stefano Omini

    • Method Detail

      • input

        public boolean input(java.lang.String[] n,
            int[] t,
            double[][] s,
            double[] v,
            int threadcount)
        Initializes the solver with the system parameters. It must be called before trying to solve the model.
        WARNING: This method changes the order of the stations (LI and DELAY before, LD after): the original order is restored only after calling the "solve" method (so if you solve the model, you don't need to reorder results, they are reordered by the "solve" method itself; otherwise, if you don't solve the model after calling "input" method, you may have some problems).
        Parameters:
        n - array of names of service centers.
        t - array of the types (LD or LI) of service centers.
        s - matrix of service times of the service centers.
        v - array of visits to the service centers.
        Returns:
        true if the operation is completed with success

      • hasSufficientProcessingCapacity

        public boolean hasSufficientProcessingCapacity()
        A system is said to have sufficient capacity to process a given load lambda if no service center is saturated as a result of such a load.
        WARNING: This method should be called before solving the system.
        Specified by:
        hasSufficientProcessingCapacity in class Solver
        Returns:
        true if sufficient capacity exists for the given workload, false otherwise

      • solve

        public void solve()
        Solves a single class closed model using MVA algorithm.
        "input(...)" method must have been called before solving the model!!

        Reference:
        G.Balbo, S.C.Bruell, L.Cerchio, D.Chiaberto, L.Molinatti
        "Mean Value Analysis of Closed Load Dependent Networks"
        Specified by:
        solve in class Solver

      • solve

        public void solve(boolean intermediate)
        Solves a single class closed model using MVA algorithm.
        "input(...)" method must have been called before solving the model!!

        To solve a closed model with N customers, all the models with 0, 1, 2, ... N-1 customers must be solved before. This method allows to save the results for these intermediate models. Reference:
        G.Balbo, S.C.Bruell, L.Cerchio, D.Chiaberto, L.Molinatti
        "Mean Value Analysis of Closed Load Dependent Networks"
        Parameters:
        intermediate - true to save results for intermediate populations

      • solveSingleLI

        private void solveSingleLI()
        Solves a single class closed model with only LI stations

      • solveSingleLIMultiServer

        private void solveSingleLIMultiServer()
        Solves a single class closed model with only LI stations, and multiserver station

      • solveSingleLI_approx

        private void solveSingleLI_approx()
        Solves a single class closed model with only LI stations, using an approximated technique (which avoids recursion)

      • solveSingleLI

        private void solveSingleLI(boolean intermediate)
        Solves a single class closed model with only LI stations. To solve a closed model with N customers, all the models with 0, 1, 2, ... N-1 customers must be solved before. This method allows to save the results for these intermediate models.
        Parameters:
        intermediate - true to save results for intermediate populations

      • solveSingleLD

        private void solveSingleLD()
        Solves a model with LI and LD stations

      • solveSingleLDErrCtrFaster

        private void solveSingleLDErrCtrFaster(boolean intermediate)
        Solves a model with LI and LD stations. To solve a closed model with N customers, all the models with 0, 1, 2, ... N-1 customers must be solved before. This method allows to save the results for these intermediate models.
        Parameters:
        intermediate - true to save results for intermediate populations
